section.name: Service Oriented Architecture
section.p: Abbreviated SOA, it is an application architecture locally or in a distributed infrastructure. An application is nowedays built up of many components which can be plugged together at compilation or runtime. Services are special components which are self-contained and maintain its own state. They provide their functionality as a well defined interface to other services or components.
Whereas SOA concept is characterized into local and remote architecture the same principles can be applied.

Though built on similar principles, SOA is not the same as Web services, which indicates a collection of technologies, such as SOAP and XML. SOA is more than a set of technologies and runs independent of any specific technologies. Web services is regarded as an implementation of SOA.

subsection.name: Service
subsection.p:
A service in SOA is an exposed piece of functionality with three properties:
A service contains a well defined interface whereof the service can be used by other services or components.
A service can be dynamically located and invoked.
A service is self-contained. That is, the service maintains its own state.
